thread.title: Elizabeth Northern places seventh at Twin Cities Marathon, Craig Lutz' AMA, Results
thread.title_full: Elizabeth Northern places seventh at Twin Cities Marathon, Craig Lutz' AMA, Results | Dallas Morning News

author: Debbie Fetterman
title: Elizabeth Northern places seventh at Twin Cities Marathon, Craig Lutz' AMA, Results
text:
Fort Worth's Elizabeth Eder Northern placed seventh overall at Sunday's Twin Cities Marathon. She ran a personal best 2 hours, 40 minutes 47 seconds to improve her seeding for the February 13 U.S. Olympic Team Trails in the marathon.
Eder's previous marathon best, 2:42:02, was set at the California International Marathon in Sacramento, CA in December 2014.
"I was feeling so g 0d thru about mile 20, and then that last 10K uphill to the cathedral was super rough," she said in a Facebook message. "I was hoping my half time would give me enough cushion to break 2:40, but I was a little short. I still came through with over a minute PR, so I'm happy. What a hard finish!"
Eder said she's confident she can run in the 2:38-2:39 range for The Trials in February with a little bit easier course.
Also on Sunday, Craig Lutz had a rough pro debut at the USA 10-mile championships. He rebounded Wednesday with an online AMA (Ask Me Anything). Among the questions asked and answered:
Q: What's your biggest running goal in 2016?
A: First and foremost, grab an Olympic Trial standard in the 10k. Second, go uninjured and remain consistent. It seems silly, but his goal is so important because for once in my career, I have strung together a long and healthy training block. I know great things will follow if it continues.
Q: Where do you see yourself in five years?
A: In five years, I see myself as a marathoner. That may still be too soon but I love the longer races and as my volume grows, I know the racing distance will too!
